comments.commentBody: Ron, it may come as a rude awakening, but you don't seem to live on the same planet as liberals, you know so little about them.  See my other reply on the true responsibility for what you, not without justification call "meddling".

Wow. Black is white and as long as your guy won the means are worth the end.

Endless cheating, of many kinds, that is.

By the way Trump should not be president. He's demonstrated in a variety of ways that he is a dangerous jerk.

Since he is not president yet, and it is actually the Gingrich plan to recreate the enemies program of Joe McCarthy, perhaps you should be a little careful.

It does not take much to understand why Trump disputes these reports. He does so to cast doubt on any negative report or finding about him. His supporters and followers believe him, and believe everyone else is out to get him.

Whatever looks bad for Trump, his followers will dispute and act to suppress any such findings or actions. He has a following of thugs and bullies. He has encouraged them to act in threatening ways and even physical assault on is critics. It is treasonous but not as defined in the Constitution. All we need is to be able to find him guilty of a felony, and he will be ineligible for security clearances.

You could end up with pence, but at least as a governor, he knows the limits despite his personal views.

It all fits with his personality disorder and ego needs The recount threat, and the Russian Intell sound threatening to his win. He can't handle loss or rebuke. Thats why his associates are such good spinmeisters. They have to make him look good. And if noone says he is the best, he tells us himself!
What more evidence do we need? He incited Russia to hack, and they did. Imagine if Hillary had done the same thing. Just imagine.
I know, Thomas. Book suggestion: A World Undone, a comprehensive history of WW1. Forgot the author's name, I gave it to a friend. Chilling, detailed, and profound.

Richard, you badly need to "get a grip" on your "colossal crust" aided by "an awfully convenient memory".  I see you (unintentionally) describing your own literate and foolish posts.  You do know yourself best.

Trump is unquestionably a traitor to the American dream. Born on third base, he has bullied and stolen and lied from his early days.

He should not be president, and there has to be a way to stop this before we descend into the depths of failure. Right now, the superrich are happy, and their casino is bubbling over. He's nobody's hero, just a guy who knows how to work a room and find the camera angle.

Just consider those six bankrupties. Consider that after he lost other people's money, he took them to court to blame them for the loss, then he claimed the loss against his taxes.

Devious he is. Honest he's not.

He's dangerous, and electors were put in place for just this purpose. This must stop!

A military coup was attempted and quashed in 'democratic' Turkey this year in order to bring down the dictator Erdogan.  Who is to say that something similar will never happen in the United States in the event of a long-lasting threat to democracy and the rule of law in the land?

MIke, I do wish you and manhy others had bothered to acquaint yourself with Clinton. This wholesale attack is so full of error, it's hard to know where to begin. It's another aspect of fake news, this isolation with people that support your prejudices.

Here's one good summary: http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2016/10/31/the-new-yorker-endorses-hil...

A lot of people refused to take an honest look at her, and the result is as you see.

"Hillary Clinton’s vision and temperament are the opposite of her opponent’s. She has been a pioneer throughout her life, and yet her career cannot be easily reduced to one transcendent myth: she has been an idealist and a liberal incrementalist, a glass-ceiling-smashing lawyer and a cautious establishmentarian, a wife and mother, a First Lady, a rough-and-tumble political operator, a senator, a Secretary of State. Her story is about walking through flames and emerging changed, warier and more determined. In her intelligence, in her gimlet-eyed recognition of both the limits and the possibilities of government, she’s a particular kind of inspirational figure, a pragmatist and a Democratic moderate. ... her claim to our support goes far beyond the nihilism of the alternative. It is also notable that she has chosen as a running mate Tim Kaine, a highly capable politician with a record of genuine compassion; by contrast, the Republican Vice-Presidential choice, Mike Pence ...."
Jerry, how did you stoop so low?  The low bar is gone; you can dance standing upright now.
Michael S, your comment is as accurate as your spelling of "Democratic".

I find it remarkably transparent that the NY Times, which advertises $50,000 Bulgari necklaces on its mobile website, is using "unnamed sources" to drive home the Democratic party establishment line that Comey and Putin robbed Clinton of her victory. (Leave aside that she did win the popular vote by 3.5 million votes.) But the sad truth, in the swing states where disgusted workers equated Trump the wrecking ball with change, the Democrats lost by refusing to run Bernie -- because the Democratic party ceased during Bill Clinton's reign being the party of working class Americans (as it was in the days of FDR).
Hillary was going to have a no-fly zone in Syria which would lead to a military confrontation with Russia.  She lost the election.  Her email server debacle totally belongs to her.

What does a Bulgari necklace have to do with Russia? You are just fanning the same flame of class envy and hatred of "elites" that motivated many Trump voters (the test were motivated by greed). But you are delusional if you think the racist anti Semitic admirers of al-right would have voted for a Jew.

Let us not forget that Bernie was not a Democratic candidate in anything but name. He became a Democrat shortly before declaring, then resigned from the party after his attempt to hijack it to advance his personal agenda failed.
I liked Bernie: his heart was in the right place and he pulled Hillary to the left. But let's not pretend that the "Democrats lost by refusing to run Bernie." Bernie was not and is not a Democrat, anymore than the hapless and vainglorious Jill Stein.
Louisa, 6 weeks is not "a couple of  weeks"; a lot new has come out in that time.

Frankly, I want to see the end of that phony poseur who has no idea how deep and wide and dangerous his ignorance is.

He is a tool for the use of unscrupulous one-party-government ideology, the dream of Gingrich's Contract on America since forever, and the Koch's are salivating at getting all their wishes under the Christmas tree.

This is not Democracy. It is a serious threat to a robust and caring population working together to solve problems.

This is not Christianity. Jesus would be appalled.

Hating, excluding, cheating, and encouraging dictators to use him to build their power approaches treason. It makes us less than we were.

There is one bully bigger than Trump, and if he gets his way we will all suffer as the planet continues to provide evidence that endless exploitation, hoarding, looting, poisoning the environment, dumping our waste are not to way to preserve a finite and hospitable earth.
Oops!  80,000 votes.

Face it, Putin's Russia is poised to do what the Soviets could not even dream of doing during the cold war - undermine both the international influence of the United States and its domestic institutions.

The communist KGB boss turned capitalist authoritarian leader of a nation of oligarchs saw trump coming and seized the opportunity to help him to power. Our president-in-waiting thinks Putin is his big buddy and that they can make deals together. In reality Putin is playing him for a sucker. The nation that trump is Making Great Again is called Russia.

Jonathan Freedland of The Guardian has it right. Time Magazine chose the wrong man as Person of the Year; it should have picked Putin.
Putin must be so delighted with this.  The US, so easy.
Perhaps along with his other lacks Donald Trump will betray his country: he's betrayed much else,
he started betraying his country a long time ago....

Unfortunately he seems to be shaping up as a dictator who sees no difference between his own desires and interests and benefit, and those of the USA.  The emperor who can have no conflict of interests.  (Sad! as he might tweet.  Deadly, I would say.)
The Kaiser encouraged Austria to make war.  Try reading history.

Can we keep politics out of the blog?

I enjoyed the puzzle, although my time got skewed due to my family leaving just as I started the solve. So I took a few minutes longer than my average to finish because I wasn't smart enough to exit the application while my grandkids hugged me goodbye. I'd rather have the hugs than finish a puzzle any time. They also helped Grandma finish Christmas decorations. Fine grandchildren.

As a Republican I think it is time to apply the Cheney Doctrine.....if there is even a 1 percent chance a threat to national security exists we need to treat it as real until we establish otherwise. In this case our intelligence agencies have "high confidence", that is much more than one percent, confidence that Republican and/or Trump e-mails, were hacked by the Russians. Until we can establish whether the content of those e-mails represent a threat to national security we must assume that they do.This is not a question of reversing the election, it is a matter of whether Donald Trump is vulnerable to Russian leverage or blackmail that could harm the interests of this country.
The reported selection of Rex Tillerson as Secretary of State is a case in point. His principal recommendation seems to be he is an executive favored by Vladimir Putin. His international experience appears to center on oil deals, not a strong recommendation for much of the world given that, as in the case of Donald Trump himself, there is clear confusion between national and personal interests. But even more important is that Trump does not appear to grasp his refusal to endorse an immediate and wide-ranging review of Russian penetration requires that on January 21st the House MUST move articles of impeachment to remove him from the presidency. We cannot risk having a president who has been compromised by Russian intelligence, or even a president with a 1 percent chance of that. Review or impeach.

Recall that Pence has said from the beginning of his selection that he stands "shoulder to shoulder" with Donald Trump, and has continued to steadfastly support him and to defend and make excuses for Trump when necessary. Impeaching Trump with Pence in his place - may not be much of a cure. Pence's record has been very extreme, far beyond what was at issue during the election. Trump, of course, has no record since he has had no public service.

Rock and a hard place.

This questions the legitimacy of his presidency. Lest a dark cloud follow him around long after he is out of office, Trump would be a fool to let Gen Flynn tell him to ignore the CIA. Your "Big Brain" looks tiny under the light of this examination unless you have the guts to demand an investigation!
Thats the way we roll in DC in case you missed it Mr. Trump. The TRUTH is an honest broker.

"The charge of high crimes and misdemeanors covers allegations of misconduct peculiar to officials, such as perjury of oath, abuse of authority, bribery, intimidation, misuse of assets, failure to supervise, dereliction of duty, conduct unbecoming, and refusal to obey a lawful order."

Where does on start .. Perjury of oath (failure to uphold the constitution see the emolument clause) .. Ditto for abuse of authority/bribery .. Intimidation .. Failure to supervise/dereliction of duty (as in failure to supervise our intelligence/armed forces b/c simply he knows more than they do) .. Conduct unbecoming (just wait for him to have his own 'Monica')

People are so gullible!

Putin is a wily old fox. He will eat Trump for breakfast. More literally, he will use Trump to damage us and Europe and expand his power.

Though the information is incomplete, it appears that oligarchs close to Putin have offered financing to the Trump "empire" to the tune of hundreds of millions. Deutschebank is notably corrupt as well (Trump's "bank reference": most banks have distanced themselves from him, which is why his financing comes from such dubious sources).

Putin's poodle.

If Trump is Putin's poodle he is in company that I'm sure you'll find agreeable:
http://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/24/us/cash-flowed-to-clinton-foundation-a...

You missed this: "The Myths Democrats Swallowed That Cost Them the Presidential Election"
http://www.newsweek.com/myths-cost-democrats-presidential-election-521044

He provides chapter and verse about the opposition work on Bernie and why he would have lost. I voted for him in the primary, but had Massachusetts been later on I would have left him earlier. His rockstar crowds and single-minded approach made good theater, but he encouraged a lot of people to fight with each other, and hey presto! you see the result.

By the way, I have enjoyed Bernie's courageous fight for over a decade. But Hillary was more practical, with many of the same dreams, and could have accomplished more, in my opinion.

Median wages have stagnated in the United States the last 30 years and the income distribution is measured by the gini coefficient is worse than any of the industrialized Nation. Since the plurality of votes in the states that gave Trump the election is so small it's very hard to tell whether this was a working class protest vote. Since they're the victims of the new American economy the protest vote by this group of people would make sense. More useful than speculation about working-class identity from a Nobel Laureate economist would be a discussion of some way the American could be more like the egalitarian German economy which still do votes 20% of its gross national product to Manufacturing.
American governments economically for the bottom 70% of the income distribution has been a failure. viewed in this light it's not surprising that there's a revolt against the incumbent administration at this time.
Oh, I think he's a coward. A closer look reveals that he's ready to duck for cover when his bullying doesn't protect him.
I read that when this guy first acted in English, his proficiency was so low that he had to learn his lines phonetically.  In a favorite of mine, he co-starred with yesterday's avatar Kirk Douglas.

Louisa, your arguments resemble those of unskeptical "skeptic" climate science deniers.

Remember we were here while all this was going down. The leaks were obviously from Russia, they were obviously one-sided, and Assange's personal vendetta made it easy.

We knew that the FBI had this on its desk and refused to out it, while Comey was eager to make bricks without straw on Clinton's email, timing his announcements in the most effective way to be a thumb on the scale.

We were there. This is not some secretive thing that happened to other people.

It was done to us! It was out and out treachery.

Since the foreign power meddling in internal matters is a serious matter, specially when impacting the basics of the US democratic system and its legitimacy, what's wrong if an independent investigation is allowed and the whole truth is brought before the nation? Trump being the President-elect  now, and the main beneficiary of the electoral outcome should rather back the investigation demand.
Prof. Jai Prakash Sharma: Trump is not interested in anything that might undermine the legitimacy of his election (and this could certainly have that effect).
